alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 13 at 2:06PM MDT until August 13 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTH CENTRAL WAYNE COUNTY...SPECIFICALLY FOR NORTHERN PORTIONS OF CAPITOL REEF NATIONAL PARK... At 206 PM MDT, Rangers at Capitol Reef National Park reported that Grand Wash is flowing and that the Scenic Drive within the park has been closed. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Capitol Reef National Park Dispatch IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of normally dry washes, creeks and streams. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Capitol Reef National Park and Fruita. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
